alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued December 30 at 7:42AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE TAOS AVALANCHE CENTER. THE TAOS AVALANCHE CENTER IN TAOS HAS ISSUED A BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH. * WHAT...THE AVALANCHE DANGER IS CURRENTLY CONSIDERABLE. ANOTHER WINTER STORM MAY INCREASE THE AVALANCHE DANGER TO HIGH AT ALL ELEVATIONS FRIDAY DECEMBER 31 2021. * WHERE...WHEELER PEAK WILDERNESS AREA AND COLUMBINE HONDO WILDERNESS ABOVE 8000 FEET. * WHEN...IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM MST TODAY THROUGH 6 AM MST FRIDAY. * IMPACTS...ANOTHER WINTER STORM IS ON TAP TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY JANUARY 1 WHEN AN ADDITIONAL 2 FEET OF SNOW AND STRONG WINDS THROUGH MIDDAY SATURDAY ARE POSSIBLE. THIS WILL BRING STORM TOTALS TO OVER 4 FEET OF SNOW IN THE LAST WEEK. LARGE DANGEROUS NATURAL AND HUMAN-TRIGGERED AVALANCHES ARE LIKELY THROUGHOUT THE DAY FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS EXIST. CAREFUL SNOWPACK EVALUATION, CAUTIOUS ROUTE FINDING AND CONSERVATIVE DECISION-MAKING ARE ESSENTIAL FOR TRAVEL IN THE BACKCOUNTRY TODAY. THIS AVALANCHE WATCH IS SCHEDULED TO EXPIRE AT 6 AM MST DECEMBER 31. CHECK BACK WITH THE TAOS AVALANCHE CENTER TO SEE IF THE AVALANCHE WATCH IS EXTENDED, OR UPGRADED TO AN AVALANCHE WARNING FRIDAY MORNING. CONSULT HTTP://WWW.TAOSAVALANCHECENTER.ORG OR WWW.AVALANCHE.ORG FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION. SIMILAR AVALANCHE DANGER MAY EXIST AT LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE COVERAGE AREA OF THIS OR ANY AVALANCHE CENTER.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
